isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES FOR 7.3 LITER DIESEL ENGINES - TEST INJECTION NOZZLES - TEST 2

svcproc.title: TEST 2
svcproc.para: CHECK FOR TIP LEAKAGE. Blow nozzle tip dry using filtered compressed air. Operate test pump to maintain pressure at about 200 psi (1378 kPa) below the opening pressure obtained in Test 1. Wetting of the nozzle tip is acceptable as long as a drop does not fall within 5 seconds. (Refer to Figure 5.40).

note.para: Make sure that any fluid accumulation at the nozzle tip is not due to fuel leaking down the outside of the nozzle body from the return openings. If questionable, wrap a shop cloth around the nozzle body to prevent fluid leaking down the outside of the nozzle body from reaching the tip.

caution.para: DO NOT WIPE NOZZLE TIP WITH FINGERS AS INJURY COULD OCCUR AS A RESULT OF HIGH PRESSURE FUEL BEING RELEASED IF THE PINTLE VALVE IS MOVED INWARD. FUEL COULD PENETRATE THE SKIN CAUSING INJURY.

important.para: IF THE NOZZLE PASSES THE NOZZLE OPENING PRESSURE AND TIP LEAKAGE TESTS, IT IS SUITABLE FOR FURTHER SERVICE IN THE ENGINE.

NOZZLES SHOWING LEAKAGE AT THE NOZZLE TIP OR OPENING PRESSURE BELOW THE MINIMUM PERMISSIBLE LIMIT ARE DEFECTIVE AND MUST BE REPLACED (IF WITHIN THE WARRANTY PERIOD) OR MAY BE SERVICED (DISASSEMBLED, CLEANED, INSPECTED AND REBUILT), IF OUTSIDE THE WARRANTY PERIOD.

note.para: If the fuel injection nozzles are to be reconditioned, refer to Section 9 in CGES-435-*, 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service Manual for instructions. DO NOT INTERMIX INDIVIDUAL SERVICE REPAIR PARTS BETWEEN CAV "BB" CODE AND STANADYNE "C" OR "D" CODE NOZZLES.
Warranty claims for replacement of the nozzle(s) will not be accepted unless the completed Engine Performance Analysis Guide (CGED-440-*) is submitted with the returned part(s).
